instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
I have an A1286 820-2915-A that doesn't boot.
It has green light, fan spin, consumes 1.200A w/o battery connected, CPU gets hot, but doesn't power on.

Shall I disable GPU?

All big coils have voltages, except L7550, that has 0V.

Diode reading on L7550 = 0.010

Can you help?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
L7510 final voltage?
PLT_RESET_L comes high?

So easy to disable GPU on this board; consider it as must check option.

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
L7510: 
PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1 = 1.160V

PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1_L = 1.269V

PLT_RESET_L  = 3.346V

I've disabled GPU with medusa, removed R8904, but same result.

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
VCORE should drop to 0.75V when board boots.
Tried different RAM modules?
Do you have DDR3 test card for slots?

Did you remove R8904 before aplying power to the board?
If not, do BIOS mod again.

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
You're write. 
It was a mix of RAM and GPU failure.
Tks.
